intro: Eriospermum exigium, commonly known as the narrowleaf eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Eriospermum exigium is typically found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its drought-tolerant nature. Its structure and growth habits make it an interesting subject for botanical study in xerophytic ecosystems.
